calcDestColor

public ColorCafe calcDestColor(ColorCafe sourceColor,
                               ColorCafe backgroundColor,
                               double lightValue)
Calculates the destination color.

Parameters:
sourceColor - The source color generated from the color gradient.
backgroundColor - The color from the background image at the corresponding position.
lightValue - The intensity of the light at that position.
Returns:
The destination color.

calcLightIntensity

public double calcLightIntensity(double center,
                                 double left,
                                 double right,
                                 double down,
                                 double up)
Calculates the intensity of the light given some elevation values.

Parameters:
center - Elevation of the center point.
left - Elevation of the point directly left of the center point.
right - Elevation of the point directly right of the center point.
down - Elevation of the point directly below the center point.
up - Elevation of the point directly above the center point. These values come directly from the noise map.

clearGradient

public void clearGradient()
Clears the color gradient. Before calling the render() method, the application must specify a new color gradient with at least two gradient points.

render

public void render()
            throws ExceptionInvalidParam
Renders the destination image using the contents of the source noise map and an optional background image.

Throws:
ExceptionInvalidParam

enableLight

public void enableLight(boolean enable)
Enables or disables the light source.

Parameters:
enable - A flag that enables or disables the light source. If the light source is enabled, this object will interpret the noise map as a bump map.

enableWrap

public void enableWrap(boolean enable)
Enables or disables noise-map wrapping.

Parameters:
enable - A flag that enables or disables noise-map wrapping. This object requires five points (the initial point and its four neighbors) to calculate light shading. If wrapping is enabled, and the initial point is on the edge of the noise map, the appropriate neighbors that lie outside of the noise map will "wrap" to the opposite side(s) of the noise map. Otherwise, the appropriate neighbors are cropped to the edge of the noise map. Enabling wrapping is useful when creating spherical renderings and tileable textures.

getLightAzimuth

public double getLightAzimuth()
Returns the azimuth of the light source, in degrees.

Returns:
The azimuth of the light source. The azimuth is the location of the light source around the horizon: - 0.0 degrees is east. - 90.0 degrees is north. - 180.0 degrees is west. - 270.0 degrees is south.

getLightBrightness

public double getLightBrightness()
Returns the brightness of the light source.

Returns:
The brightness of the light source.

getLightColor

public ColorCafe getLightColor()
Returns the color of the light source.

Returns:
The color of the light source.

getLightContrast

public double getLightContrast()
Returns the contrast of the light source.

Returns:
The contrast of the light source. The contrast specifies how sharp the boundary is between the light-facing areas and the shadowed areas. The contrast determines the difference between areas in light and areas in shadow. Determining the correct contrast amount requires some trial and error, but if your application interprets the noise map as a height map that has a spatial resolution of @a h meters and an elevation resolution of 1 meter, a good contrast amount to use is ( 1.0 / @a h ).

getLightElev

public double getLightElev()
Returns the elevation of the light source, in degrees.

Returns:
The elevation of the light source. The elevation is the angle above the horizon: - 0 degrees is on the horizon. - 90 degrees is straight up.

getLightIntensity

public double getLightIntensity()
Returns the intensity of the light source.

Returns:
The intensity of the light source.

isLightEnabled

public boolean isLightEnabled()
Determines if the light source is enabled.

Returns:
- @a true if the light source is enabled. - @a false if the light source is disabled.

isWrapEnabled

public boolean isWrapEnabled()
Determines if noise-map wrapping is enabled.

Returns:
- @a true if noise-map wrapping is enabled. - @a false if noise-map wrapping is disabled. This object requires five points (the initial point and its four neighbors) to calculate light shading. If wrapping is enabled, and the initial point is on the edge of the noise map, the appropriate neighbors that lie outside of the noise map will "wrap" to the opposite side(s) of the noise map. Otherwise, the appropriate neighbors are cropped to the edge of the noise map. Enabling wrapping is useful when creating spherical renderings and tileable textures

setBackgroundImage

public void setBackgroundImage(ImageCafe backgroundImage)
Sets the background image.

Parameters:
backgroundImage - The background image. If a background image has been specified, the Render() method blends the pixels from the background image onto the corresponding pixels in the destination image. The blending weights are determined by the alpha channel in the pixels in the destination image. The destination image must exist throughout the lifetime of this object unless another image replaces that image.

setDestImage

public void setDestImage(ImageCafe destImage)
Sets the destination image.

Parameters:
destImage - The destination image. The destination image will contain the rendered image after a successful call to the Render() method. The destination image must exist throughout the lifetime of this object unless another image replaces that image.

setLightAzimuth

public void setLightAzimuth(double lightAzimuth)
Sets the azimuth of the light source, in degrees.

Parameters:
lightAzimuth - The azimuth of the light source. The azimuth is the location of the light source around the horizon: - 0.0 degrees is east. - 90.0 degrees is north. - 180.0 degrees is west. - 270.0 degrees is south. Make sure the light source is enabled via a call to the EnableLight() method before calling the Render() method.

setLightBrightness

public void setLightBrightness(double lightBrightness)
Sets the brightness of the light source.

Parameters:
lightBrightness - The brightness of the light source. Make sure the light source is enabled via a call to the EnableLight() method before calling the Render() method.

setLightColor

public void setLightColor(ColorCafe lightColor)
Sets the color of the light source.

Parameters:
lightColor - The light color. Make sure the light source is enabled via a call to the EnableLight() method before calling the Render() method.

setLightElev

public void setLightElev(double lightElev)
Sets the elevation of the light source, in degrees.

Parameters:
lightElev - The elevation of the light source. The elevation is the angle above the horizon: - 0 degrees is on the horizon. - 90 degrees is straight up. Make sure the light source is enabled via a call to the EnableLight() method before calling the Render() method.

setSourceNoiseMap

public void setSourceNoiseMap(NoiseMap sourceNoiseMap)
Sets the source noise map.

Parameters:
sourceNoiseMap - The source noise map. The destination image must exist throughout the lifetime of this object unless another image replaces that image.
